newsitem.title: MALTA: Business up slightly on Malta stock exchange.
newsitem.headline: Business up slightly on Malta stock exchange.

text.p: Business was up slightly at the Malta Stock Exchange in its once-weekly trading session on Wednesday, with turnover reaching just over Lm178,000 ($498,400) from last week's Lm127,300 ($356,440).

The share index was up 1.008 points to 997.144, thanks to a high volume of trading in Mid-Med Bank shares, whose average price was up one cent. There were 66 deals, of which 31 were in equities and 35 in fixed income securities.

Business in equities amounted to Lm82,500 ($231,000) with 59,973 shares being transacted. Of these, 25,270 were Bank of Valletta shares which were sold in 16 deals for an average of 127.7 cents, up 7 mils.
There were 13 deals in Mid-Med Bank, with 33,028 shares selling for an average price of 146 cents, up one cent.
There were two deals in Middle Sea Insurance with 1,675 shares selling for 120 cents each, down one cent. There were no deals in Farsons shares.
In the government bond market, 14 issues were dealt in, turnover reaching Lm87,200 ($244,160). Business was mainly in the 7.25 percent MGS 2006 (II).
In corporate bonds, there were three deals in the Mid-Med Bank 7.25 percent unsecured loan stock 2005 amounting to Lm8,423.50.
